Question 30) Mass movements are the displacement of material (soil and rock) below the influence of gravity. The conditions that favor mass movements depend mainly on geological structure, slope slope, rainfall, vegetation loss and anthropic activity.
BIGARELLA, J. J. Structure and origin of tropical and subtropical landscapes. In relation to the process described, its occurrence is minimized in places where there are
A) soil exposure.
B) efficient drainage.
C) Resistant matrix rock.
D) mechanized agriculture.
E) high rainfall average.
